channel.title: Monitoring Rude Uploads
channel.description: I was thinking of making a website were people upload images and the images are put onto a homepage. But of course there are trolls and immature kids out there that will upload rude images how could I make it so when you upload a image it checks if it is rude or not lel. I was thinking just making it go to a admin box and someone approves of it. But I wanted it to be automated is there anyway?

item.title: Monitoring Rude Uploads
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Ambokile:

#E8856E is pretty close to areola colour

Hahah brilliant

Personally if I had to wait for my image to be approved everytime by an admin I’d probably just leave and never come back, as it would never be instantaneous. Voting is a much better idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Monitoring Rude Uploads
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“Frantix, post:3, topic:538853”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=657687.msg4399522#msg4399522 date=1390237835]
Have you never heard of Reddit?

Upvotes and downvotes, if an image receives too many negative hits then hide it from the homepage otherwise leave it be.
[/quote]
But this is aimed at teenagers and if someone uploads an image it goes straight to the public. I think the best way would just to have it sent a admin page they click yes or no.[/quote]

But if it were a popular site you would have to have someone watching constantly to approve all images. It’d be best just to let people vote if it’s appropriate or not.

Read full topic
